text:
I'm starved and what better way to start 
my morning than head to Cafe for some

Greek yogurt the Greeks have a sweet tooth 
so expect desserts to come drizzled with

honey! what makes Greek yogurt different 
from others? I think we have our answer.

spanakopita is a very common fast-food 
bakery sandwich that you'll find people

eating in Greece. the Greeks love their 
outdoor cafes. why not enjoy the people

watching with some Greek coffee. there's 
something in it that tastes very roasty

supposedly you can tell fortunes from this. I 
don't know it's kind of ... looks like mud right

now. My fortune looks like mud. Courgette balls 
are deep-fried bread balls with cheese herbs and

secret spices. Olive oil is the elixir of Greece 
and used generously with foods. Greeks have also

been cultivating olives for ages, so many meals 
come accompanied with local olives. It's like this

little pretzel thing or this big doughnut pretzel 
thing that you will see a mini street vendor

selling. I don't know if you can see it right 
there it's like feta cheese. the Greeks love their

cured and smoked meats so if you're a vegetarian 
your options might feel slim fortunately for

me there's dolmas a more traditional dish 
of Greek households. This is a dolma and i

dabbed it with yogurt. I think the yogurt 
softens its taste because it's got this

nice sour type of leaf. Gots rice inside. 
It adds a lot of texture. This is yum.

Don't want to sit down for an expensive 
meal a favorite street food is souvlaki.
So What's in the Tsubaki ? The souvlaki has beef,

tomato- a sweet tomato sauce, with pita 
which is the thing that you wrap it up with

and fries ...and onion and parsley 
practically everything. Is nice.

This is kind of like a Persian flatbread 
which they called Pide. this is a vegetarian

flatbread so I'm gonna try it right 
now . It looked really good inside.

it's just about like this sauce 
like a tomato-based sauce and

different types of herbs in here and 
the fact there are seeds, they've got

sesame seeds on them. It all adds to the flavor. 
Kinda like a fun little pizza, I guess. Good.
